intro: Elatostema cyrtandrifolium var. hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy leaf elatostema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of tiny greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
